thread.title: Royal Navy salute the Queen's Sapphire Jubilee
thread.title_full: Royal Navy salute the Queen's Sapphire Jubilee | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Royal Navy salute the Queen's Sapphire Jubilee

organizations.name: queen's sapphire jubilee the royal navy
feb 2017 royal hampshire & isle of wight

text:
The Royal Navy has marked the 65th anniversary of the Queen's accession to the throne with a 21 gun salute in Portsmouth.
The Queen is the first British monarch to reach their Sapphire Jubilee.
Queen Elizabeth II during her 90th birthday celebrations Credit: Arthur Edwards/The Sun/PA Members of the public gathered on the deck of HMS Warrior to watch the salute.
The guns were fired at South Railway Jetty which overlooks the entrance to Portsmouth Harbour.
Credit: Royal Navy This was my first time firing the guns for a Royal Salute. It’s a very proud moment for me to be part of this historic occasion and I will remember it for a long time to come.”
– Carl Murray, Able Seaman Gunner Last updated Mon 6 Feb 2017 Royal Hampshire & Isle of Wight
